abstracts.cdata!:
Achievement of development objectives of
            the Hyderabad Water Supply and Sanitation Project at closing
            was satisfactory. Implementation was also rated as
            satisfactory. The Project supported major improvements but
            there is a considerable way to go before Hyderabad
            Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB) could
            be considered to be a modern water supply and sanitation
            (WSS) public utility.  Key lessons were learned in the
            following areas: institutional arrangements; ownership of
            assets; improved financial management; importance of
            training; drafting of the financial covenant; continuity of
            key bank staff; detailed design of component; links in the
            resettlement and rehabilitation program (RRP) to other
            government programs;  monitoring and evaluation of the RRP;
            downstream impacts of the dam; private sector participation;
            and inclusion of the summary actions table in mission aide-memoires.
